intro: Cyclobalanus ternaticupula, commonly known as the broad-leafed cyclobalan, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically lobed or heart-shaped. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
